_header: How should I with that old man
Note:
Utley (1944)
XUtley, Francis Lee. The Crooked Rib.
Ohio State Contributions in Language and Literature 10. Columbus, OH: Ohio State UP, 1944, 18.
Subjects: carols; love lyrics; women, as speakers/narrators
_description:
A fragment of a love song, reconstructed as the first English carol — perhaps one 5-line stanza (aabba) (cf. Greene (1952)
XGreene, Richard Leighton. “‘The Maid of the Moor’ in the Red Book of Ossory.” Speculum 27 (1952): 504-6, 506) and burden: ‘Alas hou shold y synge / Yloren is my playnge’

DublinRepD11.Transcription:
Hou shold y wiþ þat olde manTo leuen and let my
                    lemmanSwettist of al þinge
